data.title: Encounter Tiber by Buzz Aldrin, First Edition, Signed
data.meta_description: Encounter With Tiber by Aldrin, Buzz; Barnes, John and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First edition, third printing. Inscribed by Buzz Aldrin on the title page. A near fine copy with some very light fading to the edges of the book in fine mylar protected DJ. See my photos of the book you will receive, not stock photos. More available upon request. This book is in my possession and will be packed in bubble wrap and shipped in a cardboard box. USPS tracking provided. #177. Inscribed by Author(s).

Cloth. Condition: Near fine. Dust Jacket Condition: near fine. The first edition of Encounter with Tiber by Buzz Aldrin. (illustrator). First Edition, Third Printing. Octavo, ix, [6], 560pp. Blue hardcover. Title in silver on spine. Stated "first printing July 1996" on copyright page, with number line through 3. Includes advertisement for book signing on rear endpaper. In the publisher's near fine dust jacket, $21.95 on front flap, bright illustrations. Signed on the title page by Buzz Aldrin. Buzz Aldrin, born Edwin Eugene Aldrin Jr. in 1930, is an American engineer and former astronaut. He was the Lunar Module Pilot on the Apollo 11 mission, the first manned lunar landing in history, which occurred on July 20, 1969. Aldrin, along with Neil Armstrong, became one of the first two humans to walk on the Moon's surface. He served as a fighter pilot in the United States Air Force during the Korean War and later joined NASA. After leaving NASA in 1971, Aldrin pursued a career in academia and aerospace consulting, advocating for continued space exploration and colonization of Mars.

First Edition. xiv, 560 pp. Octavo. Blue pictorial dust-jacket with grey and white lettering on jacket spine. Purple boards with blue cloth spine and silver lettering on spine. Trimmed edges. Half-title included. Signed by Buzz Aldrin in blue ink on title page. Numerous B/W illustrative drawings and diagrams throughout text. Boards and spine are slightly faded on their top edges, but are otherwise as new. Dust-jacket is vibrant and as new. Text is internally very clean. A tight and clean, signed first edition copy of this 1996 novel. Fine condition. Science fiction by Buzz Aldrin, pilot of the first manned lunar lander and John Barnes, a Hugo and Nebula award nominee. Foreword by Arthur C. Clarke.

Hardcover. First Edition, First Printing. Octavo; 560 pages; Dustjacket spine Blue with Silver and White text; Quarter bound in blue cloth with navy blue paper boards and silver lettering on spine; Dustjacket protected by mylar cover. Dust jacket has minor edge wear and shelf wear. Boards strong, minor edge wear and shelf wear, color fading along edges. Text block has photo of previous owner with Aldrin on reverse of front endpaper. Inscribed by Buzz Aldrin "To Irene, Happy 50" on title page; Shelved Case 8, EF Consignment. 1338412. Shelved Dupont Bookstore.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Edition. First printing of first edition. Inscribed to previous owner and signed by Buzz Aldrin on the title page. Near Fine in a Fine dust jacket. Slight separation between pages 76 and 77, where some papers were stored. Otherwise, Fine/Fine. Unmarked but for author's inscription/signature. 560 pages. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1ST. Excellent Copy - Signed By Buzz Aldrin & John Barnes On The Title Page. British - First Edition, First Printing. Book Is In Near Fine Condition. Boards Are Clean, No Real Shelf Wear. Pages Are Starting To Brown. Interior Is Clean And Legible. Not Remaindered. Dust Jacket Is In Near Fine Condition. Not Chipped Or Crinkled. Not Price Clipped. Dust Jacket Is Covered By Mylar Brodart. Thanks, And Enjoy. Signed by Author(s). Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Aldrin, Buzz and John Barnes. Encounter with Tiber. Foreword by Arthur C. Clark. New York: Warner Books, Inc., 1996. First edition printing. In original dust jacket. Signed and inscribed in black ink on full title page. Presented is a first edition printing of Encounter with Tiber, signed and inscribed by Apollo 11 astronaut Edwin Eugene "Buzz" Aldrin on the full title page. The inscription reads "To The Brantner's/ Buzz Aldrin" in black ink. Very good condition. Hardcover, as issued, presented in original dust jacket. Dust jacket is in good condition, with minimal bumping to spine. The book is signed on full title page, in black ink. Signature reads "To The Brantner's/ Buzz Aldrin." Clean pages inside, free of marks or tears. 560 pp.Dimensions: 9 3/8" H x 6 3/8" W x 1 3/4" D. Inscribed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Presented is the first edition of Buzz Aldrin's ﻿Encounter with Tiber﻿, which he wrote in conjunction with John Barnes. The first edition book was published out of New York in 1996 and includes Buzz Aldrin's signature on the title page. The book also includes color photographs throughout. The copy is in very good condition with no visible wear or significant stains. The original dust jacket is in very good condition with vibrant colors. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. Encounter with Tiber Authors: Buzz Aldrin and John Barnes Publication: Aspect-Warner Books, New York, New York Edition: First edition, First printing Binding: Hardcover Condition: A Fine copy in a Fine mylar wrapped dustjacket Description: INSCRIBED BY APOLLO 11 ASTRONAUT AND PILOT OF THE FIRST MANNED LUNAR LANDER "THE EAGLE", BUZZ ALDRIN!! INSCRIBED First edition, First printing in Fine condition in a mylar wrapped dustjacket in Fine condition (see photos). 560pp. Store Description Welcome to Allen's Rare Books. Each book in our inventory has been personally inspected, exhaustively described, and photographed to meet the standards of the discerning collector. We encourage prospective customers to contact us with any questions. Terms of Sale We accept all major credit cards via the AbeBooks Shopping Cart. Customers have 30 days to return a purchased volume(s) which do not meet their original description or are otherwise unsatisfactory. We are proud to offer free shipping on all standard (octavo) sized volumes. Shipping Shipping costs are based on books weighing 2.2 lbs. or 1 KG. If your book order is heavy or oversized, we may contact you to let you know if extra shipping is required. Each order is packed with the utmost care to ensure safe arrival. Inscribed by Author.
